subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|灬}} (when used as a bottom Chinese radical)

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – pictographic representation of a fire.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[fire]]; [[flame]]
# [[fire]] (as a [[disaster]]); [[inferno]]
# [[red]]; [[fiery]]; [[bright]]; [[brilliant]]
# to [[burn down]]
# [[light]]; [[torch]]
# [[anger]]; [[rage]]; [[wrath]]
# to become [[enraged]]
# [[angry]]; [[furious]]
# {{lb|zh|TCM}} [[internal]] [[heat]]
# [[firearm]]; [[ammunition]]; [[weapon]]
# [[war]]; [[warfare]]
# [[thriving]]; [[brisk]]
# [[urgent]]; [[pressing]]
# {{lb|zh|neologism}} to become [[popular]]; to go [[viral]]
# {{lb|zh|Cantonese}} [[watt]] {{gloss|unit of power}}
#: {{zh-syn|瓦特|瓦}}
#: {{zh-x|20 火 數 嘅 燈膽|20-'''watt''' lightbulb|C}}
# {{zh-short|火星|[[Mars]]}}

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja}} {{wp|Fire}} [[File:Fire.JPG|thumb|250px|{{ja-l|火}} (''hi'', ''ho'', ''fu'', ''ka''): '''[[fire]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひ}} {{IPAfont|⟨hi2⟩}} → *{{IPAchar|/pɨ/}} → *{{IPAchar|/fɨ/}} → {{IPAchar|/fi/}} → {{IPAchar|/hi/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=ひ|-}},{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*poy}}. [[apophony|Apophonic]] form of ''ho'' (see below), possibly by fusion with emphatic particle {{ja-l|い|i}}. Compare the development of {{m|ja|木|tr=ko → ki||[[tree]]}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|火を見るよりも明らか|ひ を みる より も あきらか}}: "clearer than seeing the fire" → as [[plain as day]], as [[plain as the nose on one's face]], as [[clear as a bell]]

subSections.title: Etymology 2
Derived terms
Etymology 3
Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|葦%火|あし%ふ}}: ancient eastern Japanese dialect reading for {{l|ja|葦火|tr=''ashibi''}}: a fire using dried [[reed]]s as [[kindling]] or [[fuel]]
